alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 9:00PM MDT until June 18 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Excessive rainfall Wednesday evening resulted in minor flooding along Little Goose Creek and minor street flooding in and around the cities of Sheridan and Big Horn. Additional light rainfall tonight may result in additional minor flooding through Friday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 847 PM MDT, radar continued to show light rain falling in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are possible over the area tonight. This additional rainfall may result in additional flooding overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan and Big Horn. - Low lying areas adjacent to Little Goose Creek will also see minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
